section.title: <rich:panelMenu>
section.para: The <rich:panelMenu> component can be used in conjunction with <rich:panelMenuItem> and <rich:panelMenuGroup> to create an expanding, hierarchical menu. The <rich:panelMenu> component's appearance can be highly customized, and the hierarchy can stretch to any number of sub-levels.
The selectedChild attribute is used to point to the name of the currently selected menu item.

By default, the event to expand the menu is a mouse click. This can be changed by setting event to specify the preferred event. Several sub-menus can be expanded a once unless the expandSingle is set to true, which only allows one sub-menu at a time to be expanded.

The mode attribute defines the submission mode for normal menu items that link to content, and the expandMode attribute defines the submission mode for menu items that expand and collapse. The settings for these attributes apply to the entire menu unless a menu item defines its own individual mode or expandMode. The values for mode and expandMode are:

listitem.para: server, the default setting, which submits the form normally and completely refreshes the page;
ajax, which performs an Ajax form submission, and re-renders elements specified with the render attribute; and
none, which causes the action and actionListener items to be ignored, and the behavior is fully defined by the nested components instead of responses from submissions.

section.title: <rich:panelMenuGroup>
section.para: The <rich:panelMenuGroup> component defines a group of <rich:panelMenuItem> components inside a <rich:panelMenu>.
If the expandMode is unspecified, the submission behavior for the group is inherited from the parent <rich:panelMenu>. Otherwise, the expandMode setting is used instead of the parent's behavior.

Icons for the menu group can be chosen from a set of standard icons. There are three attributes that relate to the different menu states that the icon represents: iconExpanded, iconCollapsed, and iconDisabled. The standard icons are shown in .
Alternatively, a path can be defined that points to an image file to use as an icon.

section.title: <rich:panelMenuItem>
section.para: The <rich:panelMenuItem> component represents a single item inside a <rich:panelMenuGroup> component, which is in turn part of a <rich:panelMenu> component.
If the mode is unspecified, the submission behavior for the item is inherited from the parent <rich:panelMenu>. Otherwise, the mode setting is used instead of the parent's behavior.

Icons for menu items can be chosen from a set of standard icons. There are two attributes that relate to the different menu states that the icon represents: icon and iconDisabled. The standard icons are shown in .
Alternatively, a path can be defined that points to an image file to use as an icon.
